title: On the Effects of Data Heterogeneity on the Convergence Rates of Distributed Linear System Solvers. (arXiv:2304.10640v1 [cs.DC])
abstract: We consider the fundamental problem of solving a large-scale system of linear equations. In particular, we consider the setting where a taskmaster intends to solve the system in a distributed/federated fashion with the help of a set of machines, who each have a subset of the equations. Although there exist several approaches for solving this problem, missing is a rigorous comparison between the convergence rates of the projection-based methods and those of the optimization-based ones. In this paper, we analyze and compare these two classes of algorithms with a particular focus on the most efficient method from each class, namely, the recently proposed Accelerated Projection-Based Consensus (APC) and the Distributed Heavy-Ball Method (D-HBM). To this end, we first propose a geometric notion of data heterogeneity called angular heterogeneity and discuss its generality. translated_title: 论数据异构性对分布式线性系统求解器收敛速度的影响
translated_abstract: 本文考虑了解决大规模线性方程组的基本问题。特别地，我们考虑任务负责人打算在一组具有一些方程组子集的机器的分布式/联合帮助下解决该系统的设置。虽然有几种方法用于解决这个问题，但缺少对投影方法和优化方法收敛速度的严格比较。在本文中，我们分析并比较这两类算法，特别关注每个类别中最有效的方法，即最近提出的加速投影一致性(APC)和分布式重球方法(D-HBM)。为此，我们首先提出了称为角异构性的几何概念，并讨论其普遍性。使用该概念，我们约束并比较所研究算法的收敛速度，并捕捉两种方法的异构数据的效应。
tldr: 本文比较了投影方法和优化方法求解分布式线性系统的收敛速度，提出了角异构性的几何概念，并对最有效的算法(APC和D-HBM)的收敛速度进行了约束和比较。
en_tdlr: This paper compares the convergence rates of projection-based methods and optimization-based methods for solving large-scale linear systems in a distributed/federated fashion, proposes a geometric notion of data heterogeneity called angular heterogeneity, and bounds and compares the convergence rates of the most efficient algorithms (APC and D-HBM) with a focus on angular heterogeneity.
